title: 'Just what I wanted
rating: exactly what I was looking for'
body: '5.0 out of 5 stars'I wanted a sleek, metal, matte black bottle, which also works as a flask, this bottle is both, and more.  It comes with three lids as advertised, I primarily use the lid with the spout as seen in the picture, all the lids and the bottle are good quality, feels a bit premium even.  I can't think of a single problem with this bottle so far, at this price point of 1200 I'd say I'm getting exactly what I paid for and more, hence it deserves 5 stars.

body: Made myself coffee to have by my bed. It kept it hot all night even down to the last mouthful next morning. A choice of lids which is a great idea which means it can be used as a conventional flask,a travel beaker or a self contained straw which is my personal favourite and once the straw is back in its flat position can turn it upside down and give it a good shake without any leaks whatsoever. Very stable base only drawback is it won't fit the built in cup holder. Highly recommend this insulated bottle.

body: Sturdy and a good size. I like that it comes with multiple lids as well.  I've used it for both hot and cold drinks and it does very well at maintaining temperature. body: This water bottle literally keeps the water cold or hot for a very long time. (over 24 hours) Its as light as feather, and easy to carry around even when its filled with 64 ounces of water. This lil gen right here has made drinking water fun again, and I say this because I'm not a big fan of drinking water. This was the main reason I bought this water bottle...to help me start back drinking the required 64 oz a day. This bottle keeps the water so icy cool that I've been drinking the full 64 oz of water with no problems. I love it.

body: Great product. The heck with biking or hiking. I just use them in the home. Keeps things cold or hot for a long time. For things that are carbonated, it keeps the gas in longer. If you bring it to your bedroom to watch the tube at night not only does it keep stuff cold as the fridge for you but you also don't have to worry about spilling it especially for people like me who has epilepsy and would not only spill glasses, I would smash them with my face and head so these are safer

body: Keeps ice for hours. The different lids are so convenient. Doesn't leak!! I have the 64oz and it lasts me all day long, water stays ice cold. I'm very surprised on how well this bottle holds up! Buy it!!

title: 'N/A'
body: 'I use this on my night stand to keep water for meds and normal drinking. it keeps the water nice and cold for quite a while. and the straw spout is great for not having to fully sit up at night (my dogs take over any space i leave when i move at night lol) so i can drink my water and keep my sliver of the bed!  The colors are great i havent had them scratch off and ive dropped this bottle a few times. no dents yet either but all the drops have been under 3 ft. I without meaning to ended up matching my coffee tumbler i use in the mornings (the bottom purple is extreamly close to the cups purple)'

title: 'N/A'
body: I bought one over a year ago, and LOVE it. I use it for my ice tea. I absolutely have had no problems whatsoever with it which is why I wanted another one. For about three months, maybe longer, I had bookmarked it hoping to have the money to buy it. Finally, finally, I ordered it and it arrived yesterday. I washed it and used it last night and tried again this morning. Both times the drinking straw lid and/or straw doesn't work, and that's the sole reason I bought it. Out of the three lids provided, this is the one I use. I guess I'm going to have to return it. So disappointed that I waited so long, and now I can't use it. Maybe it's just a fluke since the first one I got last year works so well.

title: 'N/A'
body: First of all, I love this color and the price was great! I drink a ton of water and this half gallon size is a nice companion to my 40 oz tumbler. This thermos has been dropped several times already in U-Haul trucks and aside from some scuffs, it still seals the water well and insulates well. The cap hasn't broken either.  I appreciate this durable, high quality thermos.

body: 'The quality appears great at first. It takes knocks well to the stainless steel section the lid is another story. We are less than 5 weeks into year 3 and the straw kid has already cracked and it has (in contrast to their advertising claims) begun to leak. Not just any leak it‚Äôs now pouring out unless upright. The other thing is I can‚Äôt find replacement parts. It‚Äôs not ideal to use the clip lid or the twist too options in school so the straw is the best option.  The positive about the bottle is that it really does keep the drinks colder for much longer than many similar bottles of this price point.  Will I buy it again unlikely but that‚Äôs not to say initially we weren‚Äôt impressed just disappointed now that it‚Äôs broken so soon and can‚Äôt find replacement parts.'

title: 'N/A'
body: Three great tops, keeps drinks cold overnight (use full ice cubes) and strong.  My son has one of these that I got him to show him how rubbish the air up units are.  At this stage it looks like something that stopped a few bullets in WW1, but every dent would have been a smashed plastic bottle.  He still brings the air up bottle out , but when it's hot out or its sports this is the bottle he selects himself as an ice cold drink beats a whiff of watermelon and warm water every time. I bought my wife and I one afterwards.

title: 'N/A'
body: 'It fits in the cup holder in my car (barely) which is nice. It seems sturdy. The colors are pretty. I also like having three different choices for the lid. I like the straw one the best but I tend to alternate between the straw lid and the flip-top lid. I put the lids in the dishwasher and handwash the bottle itself.'
